item.title: Interdimensional railway sim Voidtrain gets a patch that expands your inventory, a 50% discount and new DLC that's free until Monday
item.content:encoded: Welcome alien pets aboard your train in Voidtrain: Tour de Void.

item.title: The Logitech Superstrike has allowed me to get excited over some genuinely new PC gaming technology for the first time in what feels like forever
item.content:encoded: It will join the likes of X3D processors, Hall effect keyboards, and OLED monitors.

item.title: Heart of the Machine, the strategy game that lets you be the fun kind of evil AI, leaves early access in March with two possible endings: 'One is focussed on committing ALL the war crimes'
item.content:encoded: Full heart.

item.title: Turn water into goo and yourself into a cloud in this fantasy adventure with 102 million spell combinations: 'The core ethos when it comes to solving puzzles is to do it your way'
item.content:encoded: Learn to spell well in Rhell: Warped World & Troubled Times.

item.title: Age of Empires 2: Definitive Edition gets yet another massive update adding a new line of warships and 'significant changes' to naval mechanics
item.content:encoded: The Last Chieftains DLC is also available now.

item.title: A beginner's guide to installing Stardew Valley mods: SMAPI, Stardrop, and more
item.content:encoded: Set up SMAPI, find your mod folder, and use the Stardrop mod manager.

item.title: If Xbox is 'recommitting' to its console, what does that mean for its recent 'everything is an Xbox' strategy?
item.content:encoded: Divining meaning from the words of Microsoft Gaming's new CEO.

item.title: No layoffs at Xbox as a result of leadership shakeup, new chief content officer Matt Booty says: 'My focus is on supporting the teams and leaders we have in place and creating the conditions for them to do their best work'
item.content:encoded: We'll see how long that lasts.

item.title: New Xbox boss promises no 'soulless AI slop' after moving over from Microsoft's CoreAI products division
item.content:encoded: "We will not chase short-term efficiency or flood our ecosystem with soulless AI slop," said Asha Sharma, the new CEO of Microsoft Gaming.

item.title: Players spent roughly 10,250,000,000 monthly hours in Roblox in 2025, analyst says—more than Steam, PlayStation, and Fortnite combined
item.content:encoded: Roblox alone accounted for 67% of the games industry's growth outside of China in 2025.

item.title: Warlocks have taken the throne as Diablo 2's best class 26 years later, and Blizzard seems to be OK with letting them have their fun for now
item.content:encoded: The older classes aren't as far behind as you might think, though.

item.title: DICE agrees that some Battlefield 6 vehicles are 'death traps' and is planning a Labs test dedicated to 'vehicle improvements'
item.content:encoded: Will the jeep finally be worth using?

item.title: Xbox boss Phil Spencer is retiring, and his replacement is an AI executive who joined Microsoft in 2024
item.content:encoded: Sarah Bond, who was widely expected to take the reins one day, has instead resigned from the company.

item.title: Ubisoft CEO confirms new Assassin's Creed and Far Cry games are coming, denies that putting his son in charge of them was nepotism
item.content:encoded: Well what did you expect him to say?

item.title: Imagine if politics were full of monsters! Haha, no, I mean fun monsters like vampires, orcs, and goblins who use cards to hurl insults and smears at each other
item.content:encoded: Fight your way to the top of the government in card-based roguelike Prime Monster.

item.title: Nothing beats putting all my little stuff on my many little shelves in a super cozy shop sim like Thrifty Business
item.content:encoded: I love to organize my hoard of junk.

item.title: Arc Raiders proves it has one of the most wholesome fanbases once again, as a stranger spends 15 minutes painstakingly escorting a downed raider to safety
item.content:encoded: "He never said a word but escorted me 15 minutes to a hatch."

item.title: Security researchers claim Persona, the provider behind Discord's UK age verification 'experiment', performs '269 individual verification checks' on user data, including those for terrorism and espionage
item.content:encoded: I'm sure this will be well-received.

item.title: Skate is locking a map area behind a paywall after promising no map areas would be locked behind paywalls: 'We will need to make changes as we go sometimes'
item.content:encoded: Goofy.

item.title: Corsair introduces two new case colours 'that change tone as light moves across the surface' and from where I'm standing, they look fire
item.content:encoded: And I, for one, can't wait to see it under the harsh light of a monitor, as that's where it will spend most of its time.

item.title: After breaking Winston's heart last week, Overwatch players have abandoned Talon in this week's vote, and it's all down to the cat
item.content:encoded: Never forget your roots.

item.title: Capcom pleads with its community once again to avoid sharing Resident Evil Requiem leaks: 'We really want everyone to enjoy the game's story and experience as much as possible'
item.content:encoded: Resident Evil Requiem fans just have to hold out another week.

item.title: Embark's plans to rework Arc Raiders' account-wiping Expeditions: 'We didn't have time to shift the system to what we intend to do next'
item.content:encoded: It may be an optional system, but Embark acknowledges there's work to be done to improve wipes.

item.title: Arc Raiders is such a huge hit, Nexon has put Embark Studios CEO Patrick Söderlund in charge of everything else too
item.content:encoded: Söderlund has been named executive chairman of Nexon, heading up "long-term strategy, creative direction, and how Nexon develops games globally."

item.title: Todd Howard has 'softened' on remasters, but he's still 'anti-remake'
item.content:encoded: Although, let's be honest, Oblivion Remastered blurred the line between the two a little bit.

item.title: Mchose L7 Pro+ review
item.content:encoded: Light in weight and light on price.

item.title: This simulation of how an old 8-bit processor fetches data from ROM is a thing of beauty
item.content:encoded: Look at the pretty colours.

item.title: Renewed hopes of a Nier: Automata sequel as the cult action RPG's 9th-anniversary livestream ends with a teasing message
item.content:encoded: 2B or not 2B?

item.title: There could be a new God of War project involving new Kratos' voice actor Christopher Judge revealed 'late summer', but nobody should feel great about how that news broke
item.content:encoded: "I have other projects that I am super excited about."

item.title: Arc Raiders' wall-breaking exploits took so long to fix because they were 'intrinsic to the way the game is built': 'Those things are very risky to patch rapidly'
item.content:encoded: Making games remains hard, in case you had any doubts.

item.title: The Future Games Show returns this March with the voices of Lae'zel and Batman as hosts
item.content:encoded: Devora Wilde and Shai Matheson have a whole lotta news to share this March 12.

item.title: A Resident Evil Requiem pull-up bar bundle sold out in Japan in less than five hours, and honestly, it just makes sense
item.content:encoded: Capcom has teamed up with a Japanese TV shopping channel, and it's beautifully absurd.

item.title: If I had just set a new world record for GPU overclocking, I'd surely be making a lot more fuss about it than AMD has
item.content:encoded: Hitting 4,769 MHz on any GPU is no small feat.

item.title: The best Geralt, Doug Cockle, completed The Witcher 3, got the best ending, and was driven 'bonkers' by the Bloody Baron quest
item.content:encoded: And now we know he's got a thing for red heads.

item.title: Acer and Asus' German websites are down in wake of lawsuit, but Acer says its own will 'be up again shortly' so customers can get BIOS updates again
item.content:encoded: Updating BIOS is already a pain as is.

item.title: Some users are claiming Discord's default process priorities are causing performance problems in esports games, so I've tested it myself to see what's going on
item.content:encoded: And I have to say, I can't see any serious issues at all.

item.title: Microsoft's AI PC beginner's guide demonstrates how convoluted its branding has become, but hey, at least 'AI is not here to replace you'
item.content:encoded: It's very simple, let me just break out this whiteboard.

item.title: WoW dev was surprised that players 'like being jumped' by the upcoming Prey system—even on its hardest difficulty, where 'going AFK might get you killed'
item.content:encoded: "Players really liked being ambushed."

item.title: Nioh 3 has sold over 1 million copies in two weeks, breaking Team Ninja's record and carrying the series to 10 million sales
item.content:encoded: We were all hungry for a new soulslike to kick off the year, I guess.

item.title: Kick off the year of the horse with a stableful of discounted horse games in Steam Horse Fest
item.content:encoded: Start horsing around.

item.title: A redditor claims to have found a horrifying, AI-generated, multi-limbed figure in a rental house listing photo and it's exactly the sort of Phasmophobia-style jump scare I didn't need this morning
item.content:encoded: Why you so spooky, AI?

item.title: 'Our most uncompromising keyboard ever built': Razer has unveiled a new signature edition version of its Huntsman keyboard, but I can't get over the price
item.content:encoded: That's a lot of cash.

item.title: We're getting even more free lootboxes and a double XP weekend in Overwatch just for playing the game
item.content:encoded: Season 1's a hit, I'd say.

item.title: Street Fighter 2 producer Yoshiki Okamoto now makes gacha games and spends half a million dollars on each 'to make sure the people who spend the most don't end up dissatisfied'
item.content:encoded: You have to think like a whale to catch a whale. I'm pretty sure Herman Melville said that.

item.title: Life is Strange developer Don't Nod adds a dash of Alien: Isolation anxiety to its usual cinematic formula, and I think it works
item.content:encoded: Ariane is a scientist through and through.

item.title: Blood Bowl creator Jervis Johnson agrees with Games Workshop's AI ban, says 'it allows you to be a bit lazy and not put in the effort'
item.content:encoded: "AI is going to be like the asbestos of the internet and the computer industry."

item.title: 'Art and science and procreation, that's about all life is good for:' Two former freeware developers are still trying to keep it weird in an era when companies 'sell games to people in 5-second clips'
item.content:encoded: "These money people need numbers to know they will make their money back, which kind of conflicts with the nature of experimentation and trying to push the boundaries of the medium."

item.title: An Elite Dangerous player discovered a way to write new stories into the margins of the 12-year-old space sandbox, and now thousands are testing it
item.content:encoded: How the nearly 9,000 players on the Distant Worlds 3 expedition are contributing to the birth of something new.

item.title: Judging by the GPT-4o situation, game developers will have a big problem if they get serious about AI chatbot NPCs
item.content:encoded: Balance patches that tweak guns and spells can enrage players. What if what you're re-balancing is their romantic partner?

item.title: Arc Raiders' next update adds hurricanes, and players think the teaser is hiding a new Arc enemy too
item.content:encoded: Also, beards.
